Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Lamellar structure with confined hydrogen bonding nanochannels

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Thermal-recognized hydrogen bonding and diffusion kinetics difference

Other Information.Additional Info: Water (H2O) diffuses faster than D2O due to weaker hydrogen bonding.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Thermal-recognized deuterium bonding and diffusion kinetics difference

Other Information.Additional Info: Deuterium water (D2O) exhibits slower diffusion due to stronger deuterium bonding under thermal conditions.

Sieving Mechanism: Amplified diffusion kinetics differences between H2O and D2O via high-density ─OH/─OD network

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, FTIR, Raman spectroscopy, Molecular dynamics simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: D2O rejection: up to 26.2% at 80 °C, Separation factor: 5.2, Energy consumption: 2.9 GJ kg−1

Other Information.Additional Info: The membrane shows excellent long-term stability and can reduce D2O content from 10% to 0.736% in eight stages of sieving processes.
